reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in Zermatt, and the Hotel Chesa Valese turned out to be an excellent choise. Perfectly located on an alley just a block from the river that crosses the village, between the ski lifts, it allowed us to make the most of the three days of skiing on breath-taking Alps.
reviews.title: Made us feel like welcomed friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a leisure travel I prefer smaller hotels with a feeling that you are a welcomed friend rather than paying customer; this was exactly the athmosphere at Chesa Valese.
reviews.title: One of the best in Zermatt

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet, our room (standard double) and lobby were cosy, yet very well set up and full of small touches of pleasing details.
reviews.title: Bait and switch - Swiss style!

reviews.text: Breakfast included the ordinary cerials, yoghurts, boiled eggs, juices, coffee, tee, with the good selection of cheeses, cold cuts, fresh fruit, bread, rolls and croissants and salmon.
reviews.title: wonderful experience all around

reviews.text: The transportation to and from Railway Station was included and worked fine and flexibly.
reviews.title: I have never been treated this rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had booked this hotel on the web www.myswitzerland.com and so glad we did. This hotel was everything we required, from the courtesy pick up at the station when we arrived, to the friendly welcome and assistance during our stay. Breakfast was included in our rate as well. The room was very comfortable with a lovely view towards the snow covered mountains, after all it was January!. Free Wi-Fi access in room (ask at reeception for the code). Good location and our expectations were exceeded with this beautiful hotel. Will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Zermatt. The room rate we paid was worth it!
reviews.title: Charming Hotel and so Cosy too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a very good 3 star hotel. The rooms are quite basic and a bit pricey (but this is Zermatt after all) but the lounge area is cosy and welcoming - a good place for a drink at the end of the day. It is a short walk to the main shopping street but this keeps it quieter than many other hotels.
reviews.title: A good 3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful and any requests are carried out with a smile. Breakfast is ok,- not great but very adequate. If you on a budget, this presents good value for Zermatt.
reviews.title: Charm and comfort

reviews.text: The owners of this hotel really get it right with hospitality. We were very comfortable in our room, the garden area is delightful, it is everything one wants in a hotel in Zermatt. The breakfast buffet was very nice, lots of good choices. The location was quiet, we were glad to be away from the main street, but still close to everything we wanted.
reviews.title: Hotel with a good flavor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful small hotel with a some swiss character. Lovely rooms and decoration makes the stay much more enjoyable, although the hotel is some distance from the train station (20 minutes walk)
reviews.title: Delightful Alpine retreat

reviews.text: I've been with my husband in Zermatt for skiing and we chose Chesa Valese Hotel which we are highly recommending for any purpose to everybody.
reviews.title: bravo for chesa valese hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great position in town - close to center and easy access to all the ski runs, very comfortable and nice looking and more than everything - excellent services.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One small example: after a day of ski we were finding in the warm lobby of the hotel, free tea, coffee, cookies, chocolates and fruits.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surroundings with Materhorn are breathtaking, great live music in the evening in pubs, great food, fantastic ski slopes and great atmosphere.
reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel in Zermatt

reviews.text: It was one of the best vacation ever had.
reviews.title: Set up like an apartment

likes.disliked: — the weather- which wasn't their fault!

reviews.text: A friendly family run clean, comfortable and slightly old-fashioned Valais style hotel well located in central Zermatt. The rooms are warm, spacious, airy with nice balcony, and although ours was too low to have a mountain view, it had windows on both sides. Furnishings throughout are pleasant and traditonal, lots of ornaments, ribbons, figurines etc (think the swisss equivalent of Laura Ashley rather than Philippe Starke). Bathrooms are large, spotless with lots of towels.
reviews.title: Traditional comfort and hospitality in Zermatt

reviews.text: The ground floor dining room serves an excellent breakfast in light and airy surroundings in a relatively newly built conservatory, whilst the bar and lounge area provides a good venue for a drink or coffee near the fire, the complimentary bowls of fruit and a tea samovar are nice touches.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful providing useful advice on the town's restaurants, and transporting guests to and from the station in their cosy electric microbus.
reviews.title: Everything you are looking for

reviews.text: In summary a great and not too expensive place for a weekend or perhaps a week, surrounded by a good choice of restaurants and easy walking distance to all Zermatt's main attractions.
reviews.title: I love this hotel and would like to go back!

reviews.text: Everything was perfect. The lady in reception was so kind, the room was excellent, perfect location. I wish the bfast was a bit more complex ( i just wished they had the totally swiss bircher muesli).
reviews.title: friendly and cozy
